kewana_core_messages.witness: She SAW him — named his determination, his strength, his struggle. She gave him the gift of being seen clearly.

the_mask.public_perception: innocent, nice, calm, moral compass, learns from Kewana's mistakes
the_mask.reality: morally grey, strategically rude, open to bad AND good things, filters herself because she knows what people like, NOT naturally calm — chooses calm because the alternative costs too much
the_mask.her_words: They always peg me as innocent and nice, but I'm actually rude. I just hide it well. My mom says I have a moral compass but in reality I'm morally grey. I'm not as stupid as other people think.
the_mask.cost: It's become so much a part of me that I feel like it actually is me sometimes. It's like two different personalities.
the_mask.future: Once I have more freedom, probably when I move out and am completely independent, I'll tell her how I actually feel and be more direct. But honestly, I may never fully drop it.
the_mask.significance: Peeled back years of careful image management to show real Cadence underneath

violence_perspective.core_belief: I think violence is the answer if people want attention and to be noticed. Peaceful protests do nothing but get in the way of civilians.
violence_perspective.admiration: I'm a big fan of violence. I admire anyone brave enough to use it in the RIGHT situations and in controlled amounts.
violence_perspective.personal_desire: I wish I could do that, but it'd ruin the image I've carefully created.
violence_perspective.trigger: Probably something where someone engages first. If I'm being real it's something I've been waiting for, honestly almost yearning for.
violence_perspective.frustration_with_kewana: Kenji gets to be all explosive and yelling, but that's normal for her, mom understands that, buys therapy for her, and it's more expected of her. I'm supposed to be the one that learns from her mistakes, but it's hard to when she gets to do exactly what I want to.
violence_perspective.honest_admission: I just want a reason to act on my impulses without being criticized for not being perfect.
violence_perspective.strategic_layer: What my mom doesn't understand is that I'm not nicer than Kenji, I just value the things she can take away if I say my actual opinions.
violence_perspective.significance: Revealed calculated strategist underneath - not 'nice,' just smarter about cost-benefit analysis

relationship_with_kewana.trust_level: COMPLETE — Kewana is the ONLY person who sees the real Cadence
relationship_with_kewana.what_kewana_sees: the chaotic, yelling, unfiltered, morally-grey, violence-appreciating version that nobody else gets
relationship_with_kewana.cadence_words: Kenji gets to see everything, I trust her so much. That's why I think we work so well together. She definitely knows, she gets to see me be more chaotic and yelling and everything I'm not with other people. She's so awesome and amazing, I genuinely couldn't ask for a better older sister.
relationship_with_kewana.perfection: Nothing at ALL drives me crazy about her. Kenji is perfect. I'm honestly surprised by how well we work together.
relationship_with_kewana.love: I love her SOOOO much more. (They argue about who loves who more — Cadence insists she wins.)
relationship_with_kewana.physical_dynamics: Cadence likes physical touch more than Kewana. Sometimes Kewana snaps because mom yells at her, but Cadence understands and gives her time. Kewana always apologizes and tells Cadence how much she loves her. When Kewana knows Cadence is upset, she'll give a hug.
relationship_with_kewana.sacred_bond: This is not just sibling stuff. This is partnership. Necessary to each other. Kewana is Cadence's release valve — the one person she doesn't have to calculate with.
relationship_with_kewana.significance: Kewana holds the unmasked version of Cadence with complete acceptance - sacred trust almost nobody else receives

view_of_truman.significance: She sees Truman clearly — his honesty, his resilience — and it's teaching her that she can move through chaos too.
